opener.salute: To John A Smith Clerk of the Circuit Court for the District of Cola

div3.p: Benjamin Loundes of Prince Georges County Maryland having claim to the service or labor of the undersigned and having refused or neglected to file in your office the Statement in writing or schedule provided for in the 9th Section of an act of Congress entitled, "An Act for the release of certain persons held to service or labor in the District of Columbia," Approved April 16th 1862.
You will please file the annexed schedule in pursuance of an act supplementary to the above recited act, Approved July 12th 1862.
The undersigned resided in said District before and at the time of the passage of said act and for nine years previous with the consent of her owner.
div3.ab: Sarah Ann Beckett Age 20 years. Mulatto. Height 5 feet 1 ½ inches
div3.closer:
her X mark Sarah Ann Beckett
Witness
C. Ingle

div3.ab: Recorded in Manumission Record no. 2 folio 97

div3.p: The Commissioners, satisfied on the testimony of Mary Thomas, of the truth of the within statement order the same to be so reported to the Clerk of the Circuit Court of the District of Columbia
div3.closer: Oct. 29, 1862 Wm. R. Woodward Clerk to the Commissioners

div2.p: Mary Thomas. Prospect St Georgetn Know servant was here on the 16 April last at Mr Frank Loundes to whom she was hired by his brother Mr Benjamin Loundes for 9 years. I have been living at same house for 3 years I was always on same street. Mr F. Loundes was no use of papers. been here all time continuously.
